content:
I would like to improve the search of our lint list to support the lint names with dashes like: verbose-file-reads. The console output usually references the lint name with dashes and it's always unnecessary work to replace the dashed with underscores to find the lint. Is that okay with you?

(I didn't knew if I should create an issue for that :sweat_smile: )

IMO that would be great! Ideally spaces should work (I think they don't now) and the words out of order too.

Another step would be to search also inside the lint doc, but that would probably require a bigger change :smile:

I'll see how difficult it is to expand the search for spaces as well :upside_down: . The search currently goes through the documentation but the entered words have to be right next to each other. I also thought about creating a discussion issue to get some feedback about the list or other improvement ideas for the list. That could also fall under the topic of Usability in the 2021 roadmap :thinking:
There are also some more website issues filed under the website label: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/labels/L-website
